name: Queen's Road East
description: One of the oldest roads in Hong Kong. Connected Central to the eastern districts.

name: Hung Shing Temple
description: Hung Shing Temples or Tai Wong Temples are temples dedicated to Hung Shing Tai Wong. Hung Shing temples have been widely built in southern China, especially Guangdong province and in Hong Kong.

name: Hong Kong Grand Theatre
description: Hong Kong Grand Theatre operated during the period 1958 - 1976, except for a temporary suspension in the early 1970s. Prior to its operation, another theatre operated at the same site, considered as 1st generation Grand Theatre.

name: Blue House
description: Blue House is named after the blue colour painted on its external walls. It is one of the few remaining examples of tong lau of the balcony type in Hong Kong and is listed as a Grade I historic building.

name: Lee Tung Street
description: Lee Tung Street, known as the Wedding Card Street by locals, is a street famed in Hong Kong and abroad as a centre for publishing and for the manufacturing of wedding cards and other similar items.

name: Nam Koo Terrace
description: Nam Koo Terrace is a Grade I Historic Building located at No. 55 Ship Street, Wan Chai, Hong Kong, popularly known as "The Wan Chai Haunted House"

name: Sailors' Home and Missions to Seamen
description: The site evolved from reclaimed land into the Sailors Home and Missions to Seamen, later serving as HMS Aorangi alongside the moored liner Aorangi in 1945 - 46, before returning to civilian mission use through 1967. Vacated but not demolished, it was taken over by government, renamed Harcourt House and used as a Queen Mary Hospital student nurses hostel till 1981

name: The Race Course Fire Memorial
description: 馬場先難友紀念碑於一九二二年興建，以悼念一九一八年二月二十六日跑馬地馬場大火中的死難者紀念碑位於掃桿埔現時香港大球場位置上方的山坡，是全港唯一為這宗災難的遇難者而建的紀念碑，於二〇一五年列為古蹟。

name: Ship Street
description: It starts from Johnston Road, crosses Queen's Road East and goes uphill southward and reaches Kennedy Road. Part of the street is ladders and much of the century-old buildings are abandoned. Locals often refer to these buildings as the "Ghost House".

name: Wan Chai Power Station
description: 灣仔發電廠（英語：Wan Chai Power Station）是香港昔日一座火力發電廠，為香港第一所發電站[1]，位於今日香港島灣仔永豐街一帶。

name: Tik Loong Lane
description: 迪龍里（英語：Tik Lung Lane），是一條已消失的小巷，原位於香港灣仔，道路是與皇后大道東交界的一條盡頭路，在1980年代興建胡忠大廈時成為其中一部分。
